title: Cardano Research Community Latam
summary: Interoperability professionals and enthusiasts in Latin America are not connected, which hinders collaboration and the creation of shared standards. The lack of a common meeting place for researchers
solution: Create a space for the exchange of scientific and academic knowledge regarding the interoperability of the Cardano ecosystem with other blockchains in Latin America
proposer_name: Research Center for Innovation and Technology Funintec

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Who you’re targeting, how you’ll reach them, and why this matters for Cardano?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
To create a learning path and a database that capitalizes on existing talent, fostering collaboration on standards and best practices, accelerating digital transformation in Latin America. The importance of centralizing this knowledge lies in enhancing Cardano's inherent characteristics within the regional ecosystem.

By creating a learning path and a database of experts, scientifically rigorous research (a characteristic of Cardano) on the Plutus and Haskell protocols is promoted, ensuring that smart contracts implemented in the region are secure, auditable, and based on evidence, not conjecture.

Having experts centralized in Latin America ensures that the region has a strong and well-informed technical voice in ecosystem decision-making. Local experts can drive and execute Catalyst proposals relevant to regional development.

The solution is an engine for Cardano to consolidate itself as a global and decentralized infrastructure by ensuring technical participation and relevance of the ecosystem in Latin America.

The centralization of experts is complemented by a Learning Path designed for the continuous renewal and expansion of talent in the region. The path will create a formal meeting mechanism for researchers. Enthusiasts would have a clear path to becoming experts, interacting with specialists in research sessions.

sub_fields.title: Provide a list of key activities of your project:
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
1. Design the structure of the learning path, identifying relevant elements such as: Characterization, location, meetings, lines of research, and implementation schedules.

2. Design the database architecture: data, infrastructure, security and privacy protocols (GDPR, local legislation). 

3. Define criteria and expertise profiles, distinguishing between developers, researchers, and enthusiasts.  

4. Establish the credential validation process and define the mechanism for continuous auditing of research and articles in the repository. 

5. Plan and execute researcher meetings.

6. Design and implement campaigns to socialize scientific knowledge.

sub_fields.title: What are your success metrics?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
1. Total number of verified experts and enthusiasts

2. Geographic distribution of experts and enthusiasts

3. Percentage of expert and enthusiast applications that meet the criteria

4. Frequency of expert and enthusiast profile updates

5. Total number of meetings held

6.    Total number of attendees at meetings

7.    Total database queries

8.     Number of research projects or documents published

9.    Number of experts and enthusiasts per line of research

10.    Number of publications by experts and enthusiasts per line of research

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The dispersion of information on expert accreditations and experience is a significant obstacle. Without a reliable registry, organizations risk hiring unverified specialists, increasing the likelihood of system integration failures.

Establish the interoperability learning path for specialists and enthusiasts in the field of research related to topics concerning the Cardano ecosystem as a third-generation blockchain in Latin America.

Create a database of accredited specialists and enthusiasts with proven experience in interoperability, particularly in emerging technologies of the Cardano ecosystem as a third-generation blockchain in Latin America.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
•    Strengthening the CARDANO ecosystem in the region by bringing together specialists in the field of research, through the creation of solid and collaborative knowledge networks on standards and best practices in interoperability.

•    The availability of a unique repository of accredited specialists and enthusiasts in interoperability, which will contribute to the digital transformation in Latin America.

•	Increased confidentiality, integrity, and quality of information captured in a database, expanding the reach of the Cardano ecosystem as a third-generation blockchain in Latin America.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
The feasibility of this project is high, as it has a team of highly qualified professionals with extensive teaching backgrounds and research experience. 

 The centralization of information from experts and enthusiasts allows for efficient and specific development in the area of research, fostering collaboration and thus responding to the needs of Latin America.

The “Learning Path” ensures “continuous renewal and expansion of talent,” creating a constant flow of new experts and formal researchers.

sub_fields.answer:
Activities:

Finalize the approach strategy for universities and research centers for the entire period of  months.

Develop a promotional plan to increase visibility and drive participation at the center.
